title: problem with apple tv on firefox on imac running OS catalina
content:
we have 2 imacs here:

imac A just had OS catalina installed and firefox is shown as up to date running v 115.15. However, while it loads the apple tv website the site remains unresponsive to input.

imac B is runnning OS Sonoma and firefox is shown as up to date running v 130.01. There is no problem with the apple tv site, which responds to input.

So: why can't I update firefox to the latest version on imac A and why is the apple tv website unresponsive when it works on imac B running an older OS?

title: Tabs not opening separately
content:
Clicking on a toolbar shortcut, each selection overwrite the existing open tab instead of opening a separate tab. For Example, I opened Facebook and then LIRR, the image below only shows the LIRR tab. The same thing happens in Chrome.

(I was in Customize Toolbar earlier but didn't touch the shortcut tabs and they all still display. If I open a shortcut from my desktop, they open in separate tabs just not from custom toolbar). Images below displays my current settings in what I thought may help.

Windows Version 

 OS Name	Microsoft Windows 11 Home  Version	10.0.22631 Build 22631

Firefox Version: 130.0.1 (64 bit)

I unchecked FF tab settings, Rechecked FF Tab Settings, went to Task Manager and ended FF task, Restarted multiple times, checked for FF updates, ran Malwarebytes Antivirus and Windows Defender, nothing seemed to fix.

Help please, not a super technical person. :P

title: How come Google Meet takes me to a 404 page on Firefox only (dont have this issue on any other browser)
content:
In recent weeks when I open my Macbook and go to https://meet.google.com, the page that loads says "404. That’s an error. The requested URL was not found on this server. That’s all we know." The issue is only on Firefox and not Chrome or Safari. When I see the error page, I look at the URL and it has the word "unsupported": https://meet.google.com/unsupported?meetingCode=landing&ref=https://meet.google.com/landing

So I dragged firefox to the trash, reinstalled and the issue persisted. I do not have a VPN. I'm using my own Wifi at home. If I switch to my desktop computer (m2 mac ultra) and go to the same Google Meet URL, I don't get a 404 error on firefox, however no one can hear my microphone any more as of 1 month ago, when I didn't have this issue in the past and I've done everything that everyone has told me to (in order to fix it) and nothing has worked.

Laptop: MacBook Pro 2021, MacOS Sequoia 15.0 Firefox: 13.0.1 (64 bit)

title: äänensäätö Yle Areenan podcasteissa.
content: Kun kuuntelen Yle Areenassa podcastia, volyyminappulan vieressä ei näy volyyminsäätö-vierityspalkkia. Nappulasta ääni vain menee päälle tai pois. Ongelma on se, että vaikka tietokoneen volyymit on täysillä, podcast kuuluu liian hiljaa. Ongelmaa ei esiinny missään muualla, Ylen videoissa ja tv-ohjelmissa volyyminsäätö toimii normaalisti. Samoin esim. Youtubessa. Ongelma ilmeni kun tietokoneelleni asennettiin uusi versio Linux Ubuntusta. Itse asiassa kun otin Mozillan käyttöön, homma toimi hetken ok, mutta kun loin Mozilla-tilin, ongelma ilmeni. Aiemmin sama oli ilmennyt Chromella. Nyt ei auta, vaikka kirjautuisin Mozillasta pois. Tai Yle Areenasta. Kaikki evästeet olen sallinut, joten siitä ei ainakaan ole kiinni. Todella mystistä, eikä Ylenkään tekninen tuki osannut auttaa.

title: Embedded YouTube & VPN
content:
Hi,

Recently, I have noticed that when using Firefox, if I try to view an embedded YouTube video on sites that I visit regularly, instead of the embedded video playing, I now get a message on the video window that says, "Sign-in to confirm you are not a Bot. However, there is no option to 'sign-in', so I am not able to view the video. (screenshot attached)''

I did a little testing and discovered 2 things which I thought were noteworthy:

1) If I turned-off my VPN (Norton), then the embedded video plays in Firefox without any issues.

2) If I access the same site within the Chrome browser then the embedded video play regardless of whether I have the VPN service On or Off.

Strange, but true !!

I cannot find any Firefox Settings that address this issue.

Any clues?

Thanks.

title: FF running insanely slow
content:
Hi,

For the past couple of months, FF has been running insanely slow. It takes several minutes for webpages to load. My full-fibre broadband is up to speed, I've cleared the cache numerous times, I've disabled most of my extensions, I'm running the latest version, and I only have 5-6 tabs open max.

When things are really slow, the task manager shows that FF is using huge amounts of memory, with more FF processes showing that I have tabs open.

According to a thread last year, Malwarebytes Browserguard was slowing FF down. Is this still the case? If so, what non-slowing alternative do you recommend? I don't want to turn it off until I have another one installed.

Thanks!

title: I can't connect/link connect anymore my Firefox account...
content:
Hi,

I have a big issue with my Firefox account.

Today I tried to changed my password. But everytime, I had the error message "Current password is wrong".

So, to change my password, I decided to reset my password with a recovery key, to keep all my data (passwords, bookmarks, etc)

I changed my password successfully.

But unfortunately, I can't connect/link my Firefox account anymore to my Firefox browser (Windows 10) and to my Firefox mobile app (Android 14).

When I try to do it, I have the message "Connection to Firefox has been established" (in French).

After that, I am connected to my Firefox account on Mozilla website. But I am not connected to my account on Firefox browser (Windows 10) and on Firefox mobile app (Android 14).

This is not normal.

Moreover, if I look to the history of my connections, I see the messages: "Connection to the account failed".

So, I think there is an issue on my Firefox account. I can't connect it / link it anymore to Firefox browser (Windows 10) and Firefox mobile app (Android 14). Before I reset my password with the recovery key, I hadn't this bothering issue.

But if i try with a other Firefox account, there is no issue. I can link it to Firefox browser of Firefox mobile app.

I need to link/connect my Firefox account again to Firefox browser and Firefox mobile app. I have all my passwords and bookmarks on it. It's very important!

This issue is very bothering... It's not normal that I can't link my Firefox account anymore to my Firefox browser and Firefox mobile app whereas I can connect to my Firefox account on Mozilla website.

I have already uninstall and reinstall the Firefox browser (Windows 10) and Firefox mobile app (Android 14), but the issue still there.

Could you help me, please?


I look forward to hearing from you,

Regards,

Stixen
creator: al64
